notes: 4 suspected. TTP militants were killed, 2 injured in a US drone attack on a car in Amborshaga, Dattakhel on 8 Sep 2010.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: A US drone fired four missiles and killed 5 suspected. TTP militants in Dattakhel on 3 September 2010. Ten sustained injuries.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: 4 Al-Qaeda linked militants were killed when US drones fired missiles at a target in Data Khel tehsil in North Waziristan on 10th of December. 2 of the militants were British Muslim converts who had joined Al-Qaeda back in 2009. 2 more people were also injured. Strike coincided with demonstration in Islamabad by civilian victims of drone strikes.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: At least 37 Madakhel tribesmen have been killed and another 27 injured in gunfights between two rival tribes over a land dispute in the Lora Mandai area of Datta Khel which occurred between May 8-10.
Militants started indiscriminate firing on the locals when they tried to stop them from entering in Tirah Koki Khel near Spena Khwra.Three Kukikhel tribesmen were killed.

Six civilians died when a driverless donkey cart, laden with explosives, ran into a market area of Tirah valley in Khyber Agency. Eight civilians sustained injuries. No group has yet accepted responsibility for the attack.
A man was killed when a mortar shell landed on his house in Tirah Valley.

2 security personnel were killed and 3 others injured in an attack by militants using heavy weapons on a checkpost. Security forces repulsed the militant attack and responded with a bombardment of their hideout resulting in 12 militants killed.
14 militants and 4 security forces personnel were killed in a clash in Tirah Valley.
An army captain and two soldiers were killed in bomb attack in a Khyber Agency, when security forces were sweeping the Sandan area of Tirah Valley for improvised explosive devices IEDs.
Security forces and militants clashed in parts of Tirah Valley resulting in 80 militant casualties and 7 soldier casualties.
6 militants were killed when Pakistani jet planes targeted 3 militant hideouts in Tirah Valley.
5 militants were killed in Tirah Valley when their hideouts were bombed by Pakistani aircraft.
15 Militants and 1 soldier were killed in a clash between Pakistani soldiers and militants in Tirah Valley.
7 militants were killed by security forces during a clash in Tirah Valley.
At least six suspected militants belonging to the TTP were killed and several others injured when Pak Airforce jet fighters pounded their hideouts in Tirah Valley, Khyber Agency.
At least 15 TTP and LeI militants were killed after Pak Airforce jets targeted militant hideouts in the Tirah Valley
Precise air strikes by the Pak Army resulted in 6 TTP and LeI militants being killed in the Tirah Valley and 3 hideouts were destroyed as well.
20 militants were killed in Tirah as military fighter aircraft pounded hidehouts in different villages across Tirah Valley. 4 hideouts were also destroyed in the attacks
Fresh air strikes by the Pak Airforce in Tirah Valley area of Khyber Agency killed as many as six suspected TTP/LI militants and left several injured.
At least 9 militants were killed and several hideouts destroyed in fresh airstrikes carried out in the Kokikhel area of Tirah Valley.
Seven suspected militants were killed and several others sustained injuries when the Pakistan Air Force jet fighters targeted their hideouts in Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency
At least nine suspected TTP and LI militants were killed and five injured in air strikes in Tirah valley of Khyber Agency.
Military airstrikes killed 20 suspected TTP militants in Tirah Valley. Pakistan's military were targeting several hideouts in the area.

In an attack on the militant's positions, the PAF war planes backed by the ground forces killed around two dozen militants and wounded equal number of others in the remote Tirah valley of Khyber agency. They are suspected TTP militants.

Pakistan military helicopters shelled suspected militants and killed 45 in Tirah Valley, Khyber on 1 September 2010. Women and children were used as human shields; 15 people were injured. Suspected LeI.
7 LeI militants were killed when Pakistan Air Force jets targeted them in Tirah Valley.
Fighting between Zekha Khel and Lashkar-e-Islam (LI) in Terah valley continued on 7 Apr 2011 and after fresh skirmishes the death toll of the security personnel is 25.

At least eight terrorists, along with 14 civilians, were killed as a clash erupted after the forces attacked a hideout of the militants in Tirah valley of Khyber Agency bordering Afghanistan here on Monday morning with subsequent bombings killing a family in Tirah, security sources said.
At least 4 security personnel were killed due to a cross border rocket attack on a check post in Khyber Agency.
20 unidentified militants were killed in Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency by the Military Forces of Pakistan.
A local TTP commander was killed and two others injured when a remote control bomb exploded. A UAG planted the bomb on the roadside.
At least 23 more people were killed in Maidan in ongoing clashes between TTP and AI. AI continues for the third day its press for a fourth TTP base.
4 militants were killed in a clash between TTP and AI in Tirah Valley.
At least eight militants were killed and several injured in an ongoing clash in Tirah Valley on 8 Apr 2011. Involved groups were LeI, Ansur-ulIslam and Zakha Khel.

On 23 March, a deadly suicide blast at the office of banned outfit Lashkar-i-Islam [LI] at the time of Friday prayers congregation killed 10 militants in Tirah Valley of Khyber Agency bordering Afghanistan.

Two militants were killed in a bomb blast in a village of Tirah valley in Khyber Agency on Monday. An explosive device planted along the road went off when Alif Khan, local leader of a militant group Tawheedul Islam, reached there to inspect the site of the blast. Alif Khan was killed on the spot while four of his bodyguards received injuries in the second blast. One of the injured identified as Umar Khan succumbed to his injuries in a private clinic.
Two people of TI killed and two others were injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast.
2 Tirah Communal Militia men were killed in an ambush my militants in Tirah Valley.
Seven people of the Aman Committee died while six others were injured as explosive material exploded in Tirah Valley on Sunday. TTP is suspected for the attack.
An LeI suicide bomber attacked a group of pro-government militants. The attack left eight dead and 15 others injured.
Taliban militants killed at least 3 people (and as many as 11) in the Mir Ali tehsil who they accused of being US spies.
3 soldiers were killed and 3 injured when they hit an IED planted by suspected TTP militants near Nowsher Fort in an area bordering NWA (south of Mir Ali).
Pakistan's helicopter gunships pounded TTP militant hideouts in North Waziristan tribal region, killing at least four and injuring many others.

In North Waziristan agency on 17 June 2014, the PAF jets destroyed a number of militant's hide outs training camps and an explosive manufacturing factory leaving as many as twenty five militants dead and taking the death toll in the three days to well over two hundred. Mir Ali was one specific area which witnessed strikes.

19 TTP militants including a commander were killed by PAF fighter jet attacks in Mir Ali, NWA on 27 June 2014. Besides the jets, long-range artillery guns, tanks and other heavy weapons were also used in targeting the suspected hideouts of militants in Miranshah and its adjoining villages. A senior Al-Qaeda member was also arrested.

Militants in a suicide attack on security force's Khajuri check post in Mir Ali Tehsil of North Waziristan Agency (NWA) killed five soldiers and seriously wounded 35 others while they were offering prayers in the security post mosque. Ansarul Mujahedeen, a militant group linked to the Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) had claimed responsibility for the suicide attack.
Unidentified armed men from a rival group killed a TTP commander in Khazima, Mirali, NWA on 5 June 2014.
3 people were killed and 3 injured in a US drone strike during which 4 missiles were fired at Zanani village in Mirali tehsil.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: Drone strikes suspected by the US killed 10 mostly Uzbek militants on May 24 in Khassokhel near Mir Ali in North Waziristan Agency of FATA.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: A double US drone strike on a vehicle and a house killed at least 10 people in Khaisur village in Mir Ali tehsil of North Waziristan on March 11. 5 of those killed were TTP-linked militants, while 5 civilians also died.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: A US drone fired two missiles on a suspected. TTP militant compound near Mir Ali market in the town centre in North Waziristan on 4 Oct 2010. At least 8 TTP militants were killed, 5 of whom were Germans, while 3 women were also killed.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: A car was hit by a US missile that killed 4 militants (assumed TTP). A nearby house was also hit, though it's unknown whether there were casualties from this. Took place in Khaso Khel village in Mir Ali tehsil in North Waziristan on November 3.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: At least three TTP militants were killed in a US drone strike in Mir Ali area of the North Waziristan agency, an area bordering Pakistan and Afghanistan.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: Six suspected Al Qaeda militants were killed by a US drone strike on a compound in Aimarki in Mir Ali tehsil in North Waziristan on May 16.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: 15 Uzbek militants were killed in a US drone strike on a convoy of vehicles near Mir Ali.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: Suspected Taliban militants killed 4 men, beheading 2, who were accused of spying for the US in Khadi village, east of Miranshah. 2 of the men were Afghans while the others were local tribesmen.
On 12 June 2014, suspected TTP gunmen ambushed a car of local pro-government fighters in Kooza Bandi village in the northwestern Swat Valley, and killed three people.
1 person was killed and 5 injured in a remote controlled bomb explosion targeting a peace committee elder in Swat.

PML-N leader Afzal Khan was shot dead in Swat on Wednesday. Unidentified armed men ambushed Afzal Khan in the morning just as he left his house. The critically injured Afzal Khan was rushed to Saidu Sharif hospital where he succumbed to his injuries.
Five militants were killed and a security man injured in a shoot-out that took place on 6 March 2011 in Swat. The suspected TTP militants were trying to cross into Swat from Dir.
One security personnel was injured during a clash with heavily-armed suspected TTP militants in Panjot, Swat on 4 May 2014.

3 people were killed in an attack by militants at a house in Chahar Mang an area of Bajaur Agency. The militants attacked on a man's house as his son had surrendered himself before the local administration.
Afghani militants fired mortar shells into Charmang tehsil. The blast killed 1 and injured two others.
Security forces backed by helicopters clashed with militants in different areas of Bajaur, including Mamond and Charmang, killing 3 militants.
Militants killed 2 of the 4 pro-government men they had kidnapped earlier in Maidan, lower Dir.
The Taliban claimed responsibility for the killing of 2 men they allege were US spies, found in the Miranshah area.

Two people were killed when a suicide attacker blew himself up in a remote area of North Waziristan Agency, bordering Afghanistan. Security sources said the bomber attached local office of the political agents, killing two persons and injuring an assistant political agent.

A soldier was killed in an ambush by the militants at Ameen security check post located in Miranshah. In retaliatory action by the forces, five buildings located in Miranshah Bazaar were blown up. Miranshah market bombardment killed militants and injured 15 others (unknown fatalities).

During clashes between the Military Forces of Pakistan and militants from May 7 to May 8 in Miranshah of North Waziristan Agency in FATA, 7 civilians were killed. Fatalities of 3 civilians have already been coded.
Unidentified militants set off explosives at a boys school in Miran Shah.
On December 13, a girl died and three others were injured when a bomb exploded in a school, while e they were playing outside the school in North Waziristan (KP). [women targeted: girls]
On September 12th, at least one person was killed and four others were injured when an 'old' improvised explosive device (IED) went off in North Waziristan.
On December 12th, a young girl was killed, and 3 others injured, when a bomb exploded near their school in North Waziristan.

2 villagers were killed in shelling and helicopter attacks on Karwanzai, Machis Camp, Tol Khel, and Miranshah Bypass Road. The army conducted the strikes in retaliation for the IED blast targeting FWO civilian workers.
US drone strike killed the son-in-law of JI leader along with his wife in North Waziristan.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: At least three personnel of the security forces were killed and three other injured when TTP militants attacked their convoy with an improvised explosive devise (IED) in North Waziristan.
5 security forces personnel were injured in a remote control bomb blast targeting their vehicle in Miranshah.
Two security men were killed while two others injured in a blast caused by the explosives planted beside the road on Miranshah by TTP militants.
3 militants were killed near Miranshah, 1 was injured and 2 were apprehended during a search and clear operation by security forces.

Nine Pakistan army troops were killed in an clash when a convoy came under attack from about a dozen militants armed with rockets and automatic rifles. The battle took place a day after US drone strike had hit a militant compound, killing militants.
At least four security officials were killed while 16 others were injured in a remote-controlled blast that targeted a security forces convoy in Miranshah tehsil, North Waziristan Agency on Sunday.

PAF aircraft bombarded positions of local and foreign militants in the Miranshah and Mir Ali tehsils of NWA killing 60. 30 other militants were wounded. Artillery was also used in the assaults. Some commanders were reportedly among the casualties.
Military gunship helicopters pounded TTP militant hideouts in Miranshah. Security forces killed two suspected TTP militants immediately after they attacked a check post in the area.
30 militants were killed in air strikes by Pakistani forces in North Waziristan.
Aerial strikes killed 19 suspected TTP militants in North Waziristan on Tuesday. Pakistan Military jets targeted various hideouts throughout the area as part of the Zarb-e-Azb operation.
Pakistani jets carried out airstrikes against Taliban hideouts in North Waziristan, killing at least 15 people.
At least 9 militants were killed and several hideouts destroyed in fresh airstrikes carried out in North Waziristan.

A battle between TTP and the Pak Army resulted in the death of 3 militants and 4 security forces personnel. The encounter began as a remote-controlled IED exploded during a routine patrol killing 4 military men, as the rest of the battalion responded and conducted a search operation in the area killed 3 militants.
Unidentified militants fired three rocket-propelled grenades at a Pakistan army camp in the town of Miran Shah in the North Waziristan tribal region.

Unidentified militants fired rockets and open fired on a vehicle passing through Miranshah Bazaar. The attack killed 3 suspected TTP militants and 1 passer-by. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.
The bodies of 9 Pakistani TTP militants were found on Dec 31 in the Peer Kaley village near Miranshah of North Waziristan Agency in FATA.
A TTP commander was killed by an unidentified gunman riding in a car with tinted windows in Miranshah.
Drone strikes by the US killed 4 militants on May 26 near Miranshah in North Waziristan Agency of FATA.
actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)

notes: 4 Arab militants were killed and 3 other people wounded in missile strikes by a US drone on their vehicle in a village 15km west of Miranshah in North Waziristan on 14th of April.

notes: 5 people including 3 Arabs were killed in an attack on Mosakki village in North Waziristan.

notes: A suspected U.S. missile strike on 12 Sep 2010 killed at least three suspected associates of a suspected. TTP warlord who is fighting Western troops in Afghanistan. This took place near Miranshah. 3 others wounded.

notes: At least three suspected militants were killed and several others injured when two missiles were fired by a US drone on a compound in Angar Kalli area near Miranshah Tehsil in North Waziristan Agency.

notes: 5 people were killed in US drone strikes against a car and a compound in North Waziristan.

notes: Four suspected TTP militants were killed when US drone struck a house near Miranshah, center of North Waziristan.

notes: 3 suspected TTP militants were killed on 14 Sep 2010 when a US drone was launched at them in Qutub Khel, NWA.

notes: On 4 Sep 2010, 2 US drone missiles killed 4 suspected. TTP militants near Miranshah. Four were foreigners.

notes: 6 people were killed and 3 others wounded by missiles fired by US drones at a vehicle at Miranshah in North Waziristan.

notes: At least 4 suspected TTP militants were killed on 10 June 2010 during a US drone attack in the village of Norak, 20km east of Miranshah town in North Waziristan. 4 civilians were also killed, bringing the total fatalities to 8.

notes: More than six suspected. TTP militants were killed when a US drone fired four missiles at two houses in Ghulam Khan, NW on 27 Dec 2010.

notes: A US drone targeted a vehicle with four missiles in Sherani, Miranshah, killing seven suspected TTP militants and injuring 2 on 26 Sept 2010.

notes: A US drone attacked a TTP compound killing 5 TTP militants in the village of Darga Mandi, located 6km north of Miranshah town in North Waziristan on August 23.

notes: A suspected American drone missile strike killed four suspected TTP militants in NWA on 28 Sept 2010.

notes: A US drone fired two missiles and killed 10 suspected. TTP militants in Machis Camp near Miranshah on 3 September 2010. Eight sustained injuries.

notes: A strike on a hotel in a bazaar in central Miranshah town killed 9 Al Qaeda militants, including Hussein al-Yemeni on March 8th.

notes: A US drone strike killed a suspected Al-Qaeda militant in a village near Miranshah.

notes: A US drone attack in NW killed four Haqqani militants on 25 July 2010.

notes: A US drone strike killed at least three militants in North Waziristan, destroying a compound in a mountain stronghold of the Afghan Taliban's Haqqani network.

notes: 21 militants, at least 14 of whom were members of the Haqqani Network, were killed in a US drone strike near Miranshah. Uzbeks were also among those killed.

notes: 5 militants were killed in a US drone attack in Madakhel village, close to Miranshah town. All the militants belonged to Hafiz Gul Bahadur Group. The missiles struck a compound belonging to the group, as well as a car nearby. 3 were injured. Took place on March 17.

notes: 6 Pakistani citizens, suspected of burglary were kidnapped by the Taliban and later executed in Afghanistan.
A Pakistani man was killed by NATO forces in the Bibi Jan village of Chagai district in Balochistan on March 14. 4 others were arrested and taken to Afghanistan.
TTP militants publicly beheaded a man after accusing him of spying for security forces in Mehraban Killay
On May 8, a government school teacher was killed by unidentified armed men in Charbagh Bazaar in Charbagh town (Swat, KPK). It is suspected that TTP carried out the attack.

A convoy carrying passengers to Peshawar came under attack by suspected. TTP militants at Charbagh, during which 14 passengers in one bus and four in another bus were killed by firing while four others sustained injuries on 17 July 2010.
2 suspected Taliban militants were killed during a search and clear operation at Asharband near Charbagh.
4 militants were killed in clashes with security forces in Charbagh and 1 in Matta tehsils of Swat.
Five suspected TTP militants were killed in a clash with security forces in Manglor, Charbagh on 16 June 2010.

A suspected TTP militant blew himself up in the clinic of a village defence committee volunteer in Charbagh tehsil of Swat on 30 April 2014. Police on duty followed him into the clinic and scuffled with him, but jumped out of the building when he revealed explosives strapped to his body.
Suspected TTP militants open fired on a passenger coach in Quetta on Thursday. The incident resulted in 9 deaths.
Two men belonging to the Hazara Shia community were shot dead in Quetta on Saturday night. The banned Lashkar-e-Islam claimed responsibility for the attack.
2 labourers were killed when suspected Baloch separatists opened fire at them in Quetta while driving past on motorcycles
Suspected Baloch Separatists targeted members of the Shia Hazara Community on Wednesday. The militants open fired on the civilians killing eight.
A bank employee and a government official were killed by suspected Baloch separatists in different neighbourhoods of Quetta.
bomb exploded near Double Road in Quetta on Wednesday, injuring at least four people. It is suspected that the Baloch Separatists led the attack.
At least four people are reported hurt in a hand grenade attack at Double Road of Quetta. It is suspected that the Baloch Separatists led the attack.
Six labourers were shot dead and three others injured when gunmen opened fire on them in Khilji Colony in Quetta on 14 August 2010. BLA claimed responsibility.

On 29 April, the beheaded body of a British doctor working for the International Committee of the Red Cross was found on a roadside in Quetta city (Balochistan). He had alledegly been killed within the last 12 hours. The victim had been abducted on 5 January (coded separately). Pakistan Taliban claimed responsibility for the abduction and killing, saying a ransom had not been paid.
A Hazara man was killed and 7 others injured in a shooting by unidentified assailants.

Jamiat Ulema-e-Pakistan (JUP) leader Maulana Muhammad Qasim was killed in a firing incident on Saryab Road in Quetta. He was on his was to lead Friday prayers when he was targeted by unidentified armed men on motorbikes.
An unidentified armed group opened fire on a NATO oil tanker and torched it in Quetta. The driver of the oil tanker was killed in the encounter.
Unidentified armed men attacked and injured a PML-N leader in Quetta. He died in the hospital later.

Unknown armed men shot dead two men belonging to Hazara community and injured another on Joint Road in front of Passport Office on Tuesday. The men were killed on the basis of sectarian target killing.

Targeted killings in Quetta continued as a member of the Hazara community was shot dead on Abdul Sattar Road after Friday prayers. The deceased, was a watchman and was sitting outside a shop when armed men opened fire on him. The armed men fled the scene on motorbikes after the incident. Investigators termed the killing a sectarian attack. The killing had taken place when over 4,000 members of the Hazara community were protesting outside the Governor House and Chief Minister Secretariat.
One man was killed and three others injured in Quetta in an alleged sectarian attack.

A police constable on duty for the security of anti-polio campaigners was shot dead by unknown assailants in Pashtunabad area, an outskirt of Quetta. He was targetted while on his prayer break from the job.
Three people from the Hazara minority were gunned down in Quetta by unidentified armed men.
Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam Fazal (JUI-F) prominent leader has been killed in an attack in Sanjavi tehsil of Balochistan. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
4 people were shot dead on in Quetta. They are believed to be ethnically motivated.
Armed unknown assailants on Monday morning killed two members of the Hazara Shia community in the provincial capital.
On September 21st, a man was shot dead by three armed men in Mittha Chowk, Quetta. No group claimed responsibility.

Two persons of Hazara community were made targets in a killing near Fatima Jinaah T.B Sanatorium on Brewery Road Saturday. Police said unidentified armed men opened fire at Baban Ali and Hussain Ali who were on way to bazaar on a motorbike from their home in Hazara Town.
There have been two different attacks on Hazara Shia community members in Quetta of Balochistan on April 16 by unidentified armed men. One Person was killed.
Unidentified armed men targeted a man and killed him. The man was identified as Deedar Ali and was shot in Faizabad, he was likely killed on ethnic grounds
Onesectarian minority person was killed in firing on a Karachi-bound passenger coach on Sariab road, Quetta by unidentified armed men.
2 students were gunned down and another injured in an incident of targeted killing carried out by unidentified gunmen on motorcycles.
Unidentified men killed the Balochistan JUP leader in Quetta, Balochistan on April 6.
On 19 June 2014, unidentified armed men gunned down an activist of ASWJ and injured two others in Quetta.
In an incident of target killing, armed militants killed two people in Quetta and injured a child. The victims belonged to Punjab and police believed this to be the motive behind the killings.
8 ANP workers and two others were injured in a gun attack by unidentified armed group in Quetta.
Five men of Hazara community were injured, two critically, in a targetted attack on their vehicle along the Spiny Road here on Friday
13 people were killed and 5 injured when unidentified gunmen attacked a passenger bus in Quetta.

Unknown gunmen riding bike opened fire at people standing in Qandhari bazaar in the metropolis. As a result, one person was killed and another wounded, police said adding that the men managed to escape from the scene. The motive behind the firing was not known.
One driver was killed while another person sustained injuries on 5 August 2010 in a firing at NATO oil tanker in Quetta.

Unidentified armed assailants gunned down three people, including Geological Survey of Pakistan (GSP) Deputy Director Muhammad Mohsin Kazim, in two separate incidents of firing in the provincial capital Quetta.

Militants gunned down two Shias on Double Road. Unidentified militants riding motorcycles opened fire on two people hailing from the Hazara community. They died on the spot. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
The explosives of a suicide bomber exploded before he reached his target in Quetta of Balochistan and killed with him 2 children on August 5.

On June 15, two suicide attackers and gunmen of unknown affiliation attacked the Bolan Medical Clinic in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan); those injured during the first attack on the campus of Sardar Bahaddur Khan Women's University were receiving treatment, killing 11 more people and wounding 17.
A motorcyclist was killed when his bike hit an IED in the Lehri area of Quetta.
An explosion took place when a buss of Balochistan IT University was travelling through Samangali. The blast killed 3 students and injured over 50 others on Monday.

A passenger bus, escorted by a police van, carrying 40 pilgrims was on its way from Pak-Iran border Taftan to Quetta. When it reached in Hazar Gunji area of Quetta, it was targeted by powerful bomb that killed 13 and injured 30 people.
1 killed and 20 injured as a blast took place targeting ATC judge Nazeer Ahmed Langove who managed to escape
Two brothers were killed in a land mine explosion near Khameesa Khan Bugti Village in Balochistan.

A passenger has been killed and four others sustained injuries when a passenger train hit bomb planted on a railway track in Balochistan on Tuesday morning. The bomb exploded when the Lahore-bound Jaffar Express train coming from Quetta reached Bala Nari area.

2 persons were killed and 10 injured in a blast that occurred on a busy Double Road area of Quetta, capital of Balochistan, on 8 May 2014. The blast occurred near NADRA office at Double road during rush hour. Baloch separatist groups may be involved.
Six people were killed and 15 injured in a powerful bomb attack targeting a rally of the Awami National Party in the Kochlak area of Quetta.
2 killed and 10 injured in a remote control blast in Quetta's satellite town
Unidentified armed men hurled a grenade at a government primary school at Mano Jan Road, Quetta on 1 June 2010. No loss of life occurred.
One man was killed in a grenade attack on Punjabi labourers by an unidentified armed group in Quetta.

On August 31, the house of the president of the Balochistan National Party-Mengal (BNP-M) was attacked with grenades in Quetta city (Balochistan). Armed men riding a motorcycle hurled two hand grenades at the house which exploded in the courtyard. No injuries were reported. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

Property destruction: On November 21, three containers, carrying supplies for NATO forces stationed in Afghanistan were torched after unknown assailants opened fire at the vehicles and later set them on fire after sprinkling petrol on them. The incident occurred near a petrol pump on Quetta-Sibi highway. No loss of life was reported.

Two members of the Shia Hazara community were gunned down as part of a sectarian targeted killing. Armed gunmen (SSP) shot the victims as they were en route to the main city from Hazara Town area. No other injuries were reported.
3 Hazara community members were killed when LeJ militants opened fire on a rescue team in Quetta. The rescue team was on their way to the site of bus attack by LeJ in Mastung some hours earlier.
Jandallah claims responsibility for a targetted attack on polio workers killing 4 of which three were women and injuring a further 3 more

Students of the Government Girls Degree College in Quetta Cantonment continued their protest against the administration. The girls ransacked the college, attacked teachers and locked the principal in a room to demand their grievances be resolved.
bomb planted by TTP militants on a bicycle killed at least three paramilitary soldiers in Quetta and wounded 10 other people.

A check-post of the Frontier Corps near Kolpur railway station, some 50km off Quetta, came under rocket attack on Wednesday night. The Levies Force sources said that unidentified men perched in the nearby mountain fired two rockets that landed near the railway station and exploded. No casualty was reported.
4 policemen including a Station House Officer (SHO) were shot dead in an ambush by suspected Baloch separatists in Quetta.
Suspected Baloch separatists gunned down a police official in Bolan Colony, Quetta. Police said that the unknown gunmen opened fire at Sub-Inspector Muhammad Rafeeq and managed to flee.
Suspected Baloch separatists killed an official of the intelligence branch of the security forces in the Sariab locality of Quetta.
The BLA has claimed responsibility for an attack which completely destroyed a vehicle of the security forces at Mian Ghundi near Quetta which caused 'heavy losses'. Unknown fatalities.
4 members of the security forces were allegedly killed in an attack claimd by the BLA in the Tali area (lat/long not available, coded as Quetta at Geoprecision 2) near Quetta.

A remote explosive was detonated in a crowded market in Quetta, killing at least 12, including both security forces personnel and civilians, and injuring 27. The bomb was planted under a Frontier Corps vehicle. UBA claimed responsibility.

On November 9th, 4 people were killed, including 3 police officers and a suicide bomber, and 9 other people injured, when a Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan suicide bomber targetted them on Airport Road in Quetta. A few nearby vehicles were also damaged.
A TTP suicide attack targeting a convoy of a paramilitary force killed at least 10 people, including four troops, and wounded nearly two dozen others in the high security area of Quetta.

Taliban suicide bomber killed 30 people at the funeral of a policeman, including five senior police officers and wounded 62, amongst the dead were 21 police officers. Whereas the rest were not yet identified but it did include children.
Baloch Separatists killed at least three people, including two policemen, during an attack on Sariyab Superintendent of Police Zahoor Ahmed Afridi's convoy at Sabazal Road in Quetta
2 policemen were seriously injured as militants ambushed their vehicles- it is suspected that Baloch separatists are behind the attack

Agreement: On August 14, 400 Baloch separatists laid down their arms in a ceremony held on the occasion of Pakistan's Independence Day, in Quetta city (Balochistan). The ex-militants came from several different separatist groups.

On 14 Aug 2014, at least 12 militants, wearing suicide vests and armed with RPGs and automatic weapons were killed and 11 military personnel were injured in an armed clash near Khalid Aviation Airbase and Samungli Airbase in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan). Fidayeen Islam wing of TTP Pakistan claimed responsibility for the attack.
source: South Asia Terrorism Portal; Pakistan Today

notes: A member of the Frontier Corps (FC) personnel was killed and 4 other people were injured when a TTP-planted bomb went off at a checkpost in Quetta.
